comments.author: digitalghost
comments.message:
I'm a fan of tibco GI too.
But I think GI could complete more things that out of our expected.
For example,agianst the popular of iPhone,may be there needs a complete framework in javascript to develop SOA huge application in safari on iPhone,so there's some chance for GI to gain more respect.
And I have interested in integrated the GI & google gears to improve the performance of GI and add more ability ,like multi-threading,local database .
So If you also interested about these things, plz contact me through the Email
Thx.

comments.author: Zach Leatherman
comments.message:
Personally, I don't think they've got iPhone RIA development in the cards, considering that they probably won't be removing the XSLT reliance any future versions of General Interface, since it's such a big part of the toolkit.

I also don't think I'd develop any applications that required Google Gears to function, unless its audience was solely the web developer crowd.

I'd put my money on the open web any day. Improve the browser first using standards, not plug-ins.
